item.title: Roblox: Pls Donate but Infinite Robux Codes (July 2024)
item.description:
Pls Donate but Infinite Robux is one of the experiences where players can donate Robux to each other. Of course, this only applies to fake Robux. Still, players have the opportunity to purchase in-game currency with real Robux. But, if you don’t want to spend your money, then you should use Pls Donate but Infinite Robux codes.

As with other Roblox titles, these codes will reward you with varying amounts of fake Robux. However, they are valid for a limited time. And, if you wait too long to use them, they will expire and become useless.

All Pls Donate but Infinite Robux Codes

Working Pls Donate but Infinite Robux Codes

  • UPDATE - Redeem this code to get 25k Fake Robux

Expired Pls Donate but Infinite Robux Codes

  • KEBAB
  • dizzy10
  • MEATBALL70

The gameplay of Pls Donate but Infinite Robux is elementary, as players just need to write a funny name for their stands and wait for others to donate Robux to them. However, you will often need to donate to attract the attention of other players. In addition, you can customize your stand for fake Robux. Luckily, you can earn money pretty quickly with Pls Donate but Infinite Robux codes.

Each of these codes will reward you with fake Robux in relatively large amounts. This way, even players who have just created their stand will receive a good starting capital. However, as always, codes expire after a certain period. So, you should use them as soon as possible.

How to Redeem Pls Donate but Infinite Robux Codes

Redeeming Pls Donate but Infinite Robux codes is as easy as other titles on the platform. In addition, this feature is available from the first seconds of the game, even before you create a Stand. So, to use Pls Donate but Infinite Robux codes, follow these simple tips:

  • Launch Pls Donate but Infinite Robux .
  • Then, click the Codes button on the left side of the screen. It can be easily identified by the AB icon.
  • After that, enter the code and click Claim.

If you do everything correctly, you will see a notification about the successful use of the code. Otherwise, the game will tell you that the code has expired.

How to Get More Pls Donate but Infinite Robux Codes

To avoid missing the new Roblox codes, you should follow this article. In addition, players can visit the developers' social media. This way, you will learn about codes and updates first-hand:

  • FE!N Studio Discord Server
  • FE!N Studio Roblox Group

item.title: Blox Fruits: How to Get to Second Sea
item.description:
Blox Fruits is a popular Roblox game adaptation of the manga and anime series One Piece . Just like the anime, the game has different fruits with magical powers that give players special abilities when consumed. Players can explore massive islands, fight tough bosses, collect different weapons and fruits, and complete quests as they proceed in the game.

Once you have thoroughly explored the first sea in Blox Fruits , the game can start feeling a bit repetitive and tedious. Luckily, the game’s Update 8 introduced a vast new map called the Second Sea, which you can access by doing a simple quest. Here is how you can get to the Second Sea in Blox Fruits.

How to Reach the Second Sea in Blox Fruits

Blox Fruits players can follow these simple steps to reach the Second Sea:

Speak to the Military Detective

To unlock Second Sea, players first need to reach a minimum of level 700 in the game. After that, go to the Prison located east of Fountain City. At the docks, you will meet a Military Detective NPC, who will ask you to head to the Frozen Village to kill the Ice Admiral. The detective will also hand you a key, which will come in handy later.

Beat the Ice Admiral

After getting the key from the Military Detective at the prison docks, head northeast to Frozen Village island, where you will find the Ability Cave. Enter the cave, and unlock the wooden door inside using the key given by the Military Detective. Walk in, and you will see the Ice Admiral. Now, you have to kill him.

Return to the Military Detective

Head back to the Military Detective, and he will now tell you about another NPC called the Experienced Captain who lives on the left side of the Middle Town. Your next task is to meet this captain.

You can skip this step altogether and go to the captain directly if you want.

Head to the Middle Town

As the name indicates, the Middle Town sits at the heart of the First Sea. You will find the Experienced Captain standing in front of a yellow building there. Once found, talk to him, and he will teleport you to the Second Sea. From there, you can explore the area and fight new enemies.

item.title: Fortnite: 14 Best Tycoon Maps (2024)
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fortnite's Creative mode offers a variety of tycoon games, including Banana Tycoon, Dragon Tycoon 2, and Luxury Island Tycoon.
  • Each tycoon game starts players off with limited resources and tasks them with earning money to unlock upgrades, such as objects, structures, and vehicles, to progress in their respective tycoon industries.
  • These tycoon games in Fortnite's Creative mode provide players with immersive gameplay experiences, allowing them to build and manage their own businesses, explore different worlds, complete quests, and interact with various in-game features and mechanics.

Fortnite has developed a grand community within its Creative mode section of the free-to-play game. Harboring a large number of creators and players, Creative mode can introduce various genres of maps for all types of gamers. Tycoon maps, some of the most popular types of Creative games, take up a large part of the Creative Directory.

There are many exceptional tycoon-esque maps that players can find in Fortnite . These maps start their players off at the beginning of a 'career' with no money or assets. Eventually, after garnering more and more gold over time, players can purchase more objects, exploits, structures, and more to increase their tycoon level.

Updated on July 13, 2024, by Ashely Claudino: Tycoon maps are some of the most popular games in Fortnite Creative, as it's easy to lose track of time as you continue to progress into whatever it is gamers are managing. Hundreds of fun Fortnite Creative islands are uploaded every day, so it's worth checking out the Discovery tab from time to time and seeing what's new. Since this list was published, several islands have been introduced to the game or updated with more content, which is why they're definitely worth checking out; this article has been updated as well and now contains more entries on exciting islands that are worth gamers' time.

14 Banana Tycoon

5264-4775-4768

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: bojock

Banana Tycoon isn't just one of the most popular tycoon games in Fortnite's Creative Directory, but also one of the most well-made tycoons ever. Banana Tycoon allows players to start from the bottom of the barrel with no money at all, but some bananas to help start them out.

While producing more and more bananas, players can eventually unlock money generators to help speed up the process. Over time, fans will have a large banana factory and resort. Playing Banana Tycoon also unveils tons of AFK XP, as well as XP earned from performing specific actions.

13 Skybox Tycoon

1254-1353-2484

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: grafiese

Skybox Tycoon takes clear inspiration from one very popular title: Minecraft. In Skybox Tycoon, players will craft their way through a cubed world while earning money and investing in various resources that they can sell off.

Throughout this Minecraft -like world, players can wander around and complete quests, as well as find pets to adopt along the journey. Skybox Tycoon lets players build various workstations to utilize in their world, which can boost the amount of currency earned over time.

12 Cars Tycoon

2844-7565-5598

  • Players: 6
  • Creator: brawlstudio

Car fanatics will certainly get a kick out of this Creative map, as players can access many different cars while creating their dream mansion. Cars Tycoon starts players off with the weakest car(s), but once they have invested in their mansion and tycoon, they will be able to purchase better cars to drive around with, as well as simply have them on display.

There are also many pets that players can collect throughout Cars Tycoon, all of which follow them around the map. The models (and map entirely) all look incredible, using Unreal Engine 5 to make the game all the better.

11 Rocket Tycoon

6135-9407-7933

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: thegirlsstudio

This Creative Map allows fans of space exploration to let their imagination run free, as they will be able to travel between planets and fight against aliens. In Rocket Tycoon, players will start work on rockets. Each upgrade on their rocket will let them travel further and access more and more unique features.

Building up their base also lets players create portals, alien pets, and weaponry to fight against the various aliens. While one of the largest tycoons in terms of overall size, Rocket Tycoon is by far one of the most imaginative and best-looking maps.

10 Robot Tycoon

5824-9770-6508

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: s-k-a-v-i

Robot Tycoon lets fans do exactly what they'd expect to do from the title: Build robots. In Robot Tycoon, fans will start with the smallest of robots and start farming money to unlock better parts, generators, and larger robots.

There are four different robots that players can build: Optimus Prime, Iron Man, Bumblebee, and Bender. After choosing a robot, players can grow their robot in hopes that it becomes larger than other players' robots.

9 Mafia Tycoon

2367-8090-3663

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: smippyvlad

Although it is based on an odd concept, Mafia Tycoon is a very interesting tycoon game in Fortnite . It allows players to create their own underground mafia base and turn it into the best crime- and money-generating factory.

Players have to participate in heists, print money, get workers for their team in order to increase their money and crime income. As the numbers get higher and higher, they'll get access to better heist locations, allowing them to go on more dangerous missions like robbing a bank.

8 Pizza Tycoon

2642-3224-2641

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: zigazagzong

Building a base in Pizza Tycoon is the first goal of beginners in the Creative game, but eventually being able to produce more pizzas becomes the main goal. Once given a base to fix up, players will purchase pizza ovens to grant them more sales and currency over time.

Players can then upgrade their pizza ovens to produce more pizza, resulting in faster sales to grant them more money. Throughout the game, players will eventually have a large pizza factory, thousands of dollars, and enough weaponry to take out all the zombies across the map.

7 Superhero Tycoon 4

5692-4498-7219

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: van

Like the past three Superhero-esque maps, Superhero Tycoon 4 lets players start a farm in which they create gadgets, gain powers, and earn enough money to create the largest tycoons. After escaping various zombie-like villains and starting their factory, players can unlock new weapons to fend off the zombies and opponents.

Superhero Tycoon 4 also has a neat tutorial for beginners, which helps a lot at the beginning of the Creative Map. Random supply crates can fall from the sky, which grants players ammo and boosts them into the sky to escape from threats.

6 Pro Farmer Tycoon

5024-4082-1856

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: sloth_games

Like many farming games out there, Pro Farmer Tycoon gives gamers their own farm to take care of and build from the ground up. Starting with the lowest of crops, players will have to collect money to upgrade their farm.

This also means buying new crops, of which there are twelve, purchasing new animals, and accessing other features, such as controlling the town market. Unlike some other tycoon maps, Pro Farmer Tycoon lets players steal from one another by obtaining their money from generators.

5 Dragon Tycoon 2

2523-8232-9682

  • Players: 2
  • Creator: nexxtcreative

Dragon Tycoon 2 expands on what was offered through the first map, giving players new and improved dragons, islands, and quests to take on. Starting with their island, players will have to help raise a dragon and earn money to upgrade their island.

This is done by investing in 'droppers' which earn more and more money with each upgrade. There are two different islands and dragons that players can work with Ice or fire. The dragons themselves will follow players around, using neat features with Unreal Engine 5.

4 Lumberjack Heroes

7154-1898-4800

  • Players: 8
  • Creator: itsjacky

While chopping down hundreds and hundreds of trees might not sound appealing at first, Lumberjack Heroes is a surprisingly fun Fortnite Creative game. It can be quite hard to put it down once you get the hang out of it. Lumberjack Heroes has a vast selection of NPCs, skills to upgrade, and even pets to hatch. As gamers get further into it, they'll gain access to more areas of the map, cooler skills, and cuter pets.

This Fortnite island is definitely worth trying out, especially for gamers who would rather have a more relaxing time hitting trees over and over again rather than fighting husks and micromanaging machines.

3 Raft Tycoon

8651-2962-0948

  • Players: 2
  • Creator: hav

Even though only a maximum of two players can enter a Raft Tycoon game, it's enough for this experience to be fun; it's easy to watch the hours go by even as a solo player. In Raft Tycoon, gamers will start out on a single wooden tile with nothing but planks and fish.

They'll have to increase the amount and variety of resources on the raft to increase their gold output and purchase upgrades for their raft. Eventually, gamers will notice that they have tons of new buildings as well as more valuable resources.

2 Luxury Island Tycoon

2207-6154-4908

  • Players: 1
  • Creator: digitag

Luxury Island Tycoon is what many players look for in a tycoon-like map, as it allows them to go from rags to riches. The main goal in this Luxury Island map is to earn as much money as possible, while also purchasing new upgrades for the island.

These upgrades can vary from cars and pools to mansions and helicopters. While constructing this villa and earning more money with generators/droppers, players can have fun around the island by partaking in random activities, such as swimming.

1 Castle Tycoon: Bossfight

3748-4851-5767

  • Players: 4
  • Creator: havocgames

In Dragon Tycoon, gamers get to build a castle from the ground up. In this map, each player has their own castle, and they must manage their resources to earn more money and expand. On top of this, they can purchase small dragons and keep them around as pets.

Every seven and a half minutes, there's a bossfight against a terrifying dragon. Fans can opt to stay out of it or team up with other players and attempt to take down the fire-breathing beast and its minion husks together. This is an extremely fun experience, and gamers will simply forget to look at the time as it flies by.

item.title: The 10 Most Iconic Video Game Cities
item.description:
Video games take players to incredible places during their adventures, such as abandoned temples in the middle of nowhere, unexplored caves, or planets inhabited by other civilizations. Moreover, many of these stories feature another important element: cities.

Varying in size and setting, many of these cities are remembered by players as key locations in their respective games. Whether they are central to the plot that develops throughout the game or a place where characters can rest and replenish some resources before returning to the wilderness for a new adventure, these cities leave a lasting impression.

Baldur’s Gate

Iconic In Both Tabletop RPGs & Video Games

The Dungeons & Dragons tabletop RPG features several impressive cities like Waterdeep and Neverwinter, but none are as prominent in video games as Baldur’s Gate. Also present in the first two games of the franchise with the same name, the city received a significant visual update in Baldur’s Gate 3 , making it even more beautiful.

In Larian’s game, the characters' journey is to reach Baldur’s Gate. This event finally happens in the third and final chapter of the story, where many plot events must unfold. The attention to detail and architecture of the city are unique, filled with interesting content to be discovered as players explore its streets and alleys.

Night City (Cyberpunk 2077)

There Are No Happy Endings In Night City

Despite the problematic launch of Cyberpunk 2077 and the redemption arc the game has undergone in recent years, the construction of Night City has always been praised in CD Projekt Red's title. As soon as V looks up, players see the influence of megacorporations in the universe, with an even greater disparity between the rich and poor.

Moreover, the developers made sure that exploring Night City happened organically, with the protagonist transitioning between different city districts and feeling the differences. At the same time, the city still holds various secrets for players to discover during their adventures.

Los Santos (Grand Theft Auto)

GTA’s Representation Of Los Angeles

Los Santos, the main setting of the fifth installment in the Grand Theft Auto franchise and one of the main locations in GTA: San Andreas , represents the franchise's interpretation of Los Angeles. This stunning city is explored in detail by the series' fans, housing the ultra-rich and incorporating less developed areas.

The city is famous for its breathtaking views, including mountains, beaches, deserts, and developed urban areas, all accessible within minutes of travel. Los Santos offers a unique mix of environments, making it one of the most interesting locations in the entire GTA franchise.

New Vegas

A Reminder Of Ancient Civilization In The Mojave Wasteland

The Fallout franchise has always been filled with iconic cities like Megaton, Necropolis, and Diamond City, but New Vegas has a special charm that makes it a favorite for many fans. Thanks to the actions of the mysterious Robert House, Vegas survived the Great War without being completely destroyed by the nuclear missiles.

During the events of Fallout: New Vegas , players explore a city that still shines with the old world's decadence and glamour. New Vegas is a refuge of civilization in the devastated desert, filled with casinos, neon lights, and factions constantly vying for control of the region.

Novigrad (The Witcher 3)

A Place Of Entertainment And Conflict

One thing CD Projekt Red achieved in The Witcher series, especially in the third game, is that every place Geralt visits during his journey has a unique atmosphere. Among the cities in the game, Novigrad stands out the most.

Novigrad is a city of entertainment and gangs that control the region from the shadows. This vibrant atmosphere, combined with detailed architecture, makes it the perfect setting for various quests and stories. From theatrical performances and alliances with crime bosses to hunting a serial killer fanatically devoted to the Eternal Fire, Novigrad offers it all.

Raccoon City (Resident Evil)

The Essence Of Resident Evil Lives Here

Raccoon City is an icon in the Resident Evil universe, being the epicenter of the viral outbreak that defined the series. Introduced in the first game and explored in several versions, the city is synonymous with horror and survival. It is also where players meet various important characters in their adventures.

Raccoon City's importance to the franchise lies in its rich history and tense atmosphere, which are fundamental to the games' narrative. From the dark corridors of the police station to the zombie-infested streets, each version of the city contributes to building the legacy for which the games are known.

Midgar (Final Fantasy 7)

A Steampunk Universe Contrast

The Final Fantasy franchise features many incredible places for players to visit, but few are as impressive as the city of Midgar in Final Fantasy 7 . Whether in the original PlayStation 1 version or the remake, the metropolis powered by mako energy serves to show players the game's setting and define the initial pillars of the plot.

Its design is also beautiful, with steampunk-inspired structures that enhance its architecture. At the same time, it shows players the contrast among the population. From the lower part of Midgar, Cloud and other inhabitants can see how Shinra and the wealthy live comfortably above.

The Citadel (Mass Effect)

A Pillar Of Civilization

The Citadel is the political and cultural heart of the galaxy in Mass Effect . Built by the mysterious Protheans, it serves as the seat of the Citadel Council government, housing various alien species and symbolizing intergalactic cooperation among these civilizations.

Its impressive architecture, with five massive arms and a central core, stands out as a marvel of engineering and design. The Citadel also serves as a symbol of the diversity of Mass Effect civilizations. Players can see this mainly in the first game of the franchise, where they have greater freedom and time to explore it.

Rapture (BioShock)

An Impressive Underwater Construction

The city of Rapture in the BioShock franchise was conceived as the perfect utopia for humanity's great artists and minds, where they could develop their works away from government oppression or contemporary religions. The theory was good, but the result players find upon arrival is a devastated place.

Now, Rapture is a nightmare of an underwater dystopia. Andrew Ryan's grand vision has been corrupted by civil wars, abuse of power, and the catastrophic effects of ADAM, a genetically modifying substance. The beautiful art deco structures are in ruins, and the once-brilliant inhabitants have turned into deranged monsters. The city serves as a grim reminder of the dangers of unchecked ambitions.

Whiterun (Skyrim)

A Place Many Players Call Home

Whiterun is not the most important city in Skyrim , nor is it one of the most imposing in the entire The Elder Scrolls franchise. Still, it is iconic for being the first city most players encounter when starting their journey in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim . After fleeing Alduin in Helgen and passing through Riverwood, the likely destination for everyone is Whiterun.

The city also has some interesting points, such as Dragonsreach, Breezehome, and the Skyforge. It is also the location where The Companions have their guild base. Additionally, it is in Whiterun that players meet Lydia, one of the main followers in Skyrim , making the city a landmark in the game.

item.title: Minecraft Bedrock Player Has Interesting Suggestion For Sword Combat
item.description:
Highlights

  • Adding a sweep attack to Minecraft Sword combat could be a game-changer, which is something a Bedrock player recently suggested online. It would help with battling multiple enemies at once.
  • The addition of new combat elements like the Trident and Mace show that Mojang is open to shaking up gameplay in Minecraft. However, to keep it from being overpowered, a sweep attack may require a noticeable cooldown.
  • While some players are eager for an official sweep attack feature, there is no guarantee that Mojang will introduce it in future updates.

A Minecraft Bedrock player has proposed an interesting suggestion of adding a sweeping attack to the game's Sword combats. Mojang continues to update Minecraft with new features, blocks, and more, and with additions like the mace, it's clear that combat changes are not off limits - even if they are quite uncommon.

Although Mojang consistently patches Minecraft , the combat hasn't changed much over the years. The Trident is one example of a big addition, as it has been added post-launch, and it's unique in that players can wield it as a melee weapon or throw it for ranged damage instead. Additionally, the option to block with weapons has disappeared, making Shields key equipment for anyone looking to protect themselves from enemy damage. Finally, the latest combat update included the Mace, which can be crafted from materials obtained in Minecraft 's Trial Chambers. Now, one gamer has an interesting idea of revamping Sword combat by giving the item a sweep attack option.

Reddit user Infinite_wicked recently shared a clip in which they're attacking Skeletons spawning in a farm. The farm contains dozens of Skeletons in a very small space, with the player killing each of them with one swing of their Enchanted Iron Sword. As the mobs drop like flies, loot and experience orbs litter the area before the loot is funneled into a nearby chest with a Minecraft Hopper. The funneled items include Arrows, Bones, Bows, and Gold, Iron, and Leather armor. With how long it took for this player to defeat the Skeleton farm army, though, they suggested that Minecraft should add a sweeping attack that could kill multiple enemies at the same time.

Could a Minecraft Sweep Attack Be Overpowered?

Although many gamers considered the Sword sweep idea a good one, others highlighted how overpowered it might be. One Minecraft player offered a solution to the potentially overpowered secondary attack by suggesting that Mojang could add a cooldown to it. There are already cooldowns for attacks, the Minecraft Ender Pearl teleport, Elytra flying, and Potions, ensuring that one for sweeping wouldn't feel out of place. Beyond a secondary attack option for swords, there could also be a new enchantment added to the game that changes the primary one. There could also be a new weapon added in the future that would allow players to defeat multiple enemies at the same time, preventing Mojang from having to significantly change Swords.

While modders can create sweep attacks of their own, it's clear that some Bedrock players would like to see Mojang introduce an official version of such a feature. Mojang continues to update Minecraft, which could potentially result in a sweep attack being added in the future, though for now it is purely a fan request and there is no indication that such an update will happen.
